Notes: Small inverted saddle tank locomotive; sold by 1894 to Joseph Boam Ltd., Norfolk
Larger version of the first Bagnall locomotive; sold by 1902 to the Manchester Corporation Rivers Department
Built for the construction of the Ashworth Moor Reservoir; purchased in 1913
Built for the construction of the Ashworth Moor Reservoir; purchased in 1913. Sold for scrap, 1946

Name: Prince Charlie
Notes: Built as a 2 ft (610 mm) gauge locomotive for the War Department Light Railways. Purchased in 1947; scrapped 1950

Name: Vyrnwy
Notes: Built reservoir construction; purchased in 1947. Sold to the Piel and Walney Gravel company in 1953.
